Key Match Events: Eric Wagaman scored with one out in the 13th inning when Jordyn Adams’ grounder deflected off the glove of third baseman Miguel Vargas, leading to a 4-3 victory for the Los Angeles Angels.
Jordyn Adams hit a walk-off single during the thirteenth inning to win 4-3 over the Chicago White Sox.
Andrew Vaughn hit a home run during the fourth inning.
The game went into extra innings tied at one, with each team scoring in the 10th and 11th innings.
The White Sox had the bases loaded with two out in the 13th, but José Quijada struck out Yoán Moncada to end the frame.
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington commented on the team's perseverance, stating, 'We had opportunities throughout the game to do something, we just couldn’t stretch that run, especially in extra innings. But we kept going and finally caught a break.'
Jordyn Adams reflected on his game-winning hit, saying, 'I was just trying to put it in play and give the runner at third a chance to score.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Chicago White Sox tied the 1916 Philadelphia Athletics for the third most losses since 1900 with their 117th loss.
The White Sox need to go 7-2 in their final nine games to avoid the post-1900 record of 120 losses by the 1962 expansion New York Mets.
The Angels had the bases loaded in the 10th and 12th innings but were finally able to walk it off in the 13th.
Andrew Vaughn is on a five-game hitting streak, going 7 for 20 with two homers.
